column5: Had a great time fishing for the 4 days on Callender since sunday of last week.It was I.G.Donny's birthday trip and we managed to access the ice on sunday afternoon by foot and managed some during the evening with 4"in ice the spare.Robbie was hard at it flooding the top of the ice in his area and making some good ice!By the end of thursday he had most of his huts all hooked up.The fishing was on the slow side but managed some nice eye's,pike ,herring and even 3 ling's to boot!The temp on tuesday was deadly all day with it being -23 all day long.....used the flip over shelters and heaters"Thanks Donny!!! By the end there was 5-6"in the bay area and made it nice to access the ice with the sled's. Will be back on the 25th till 28th for the anual Ice Guy Adventure Trip yahoooo! Hope you like the pic's of the gang/fish. Pauly
Heavy duty report there, Pauly. Great pics too. Glad you all had a good time. Good luck next (LONG) weekend, I know you should feel a lot safer with another couple of inches by then.
congrats great report umm yummy cold water ling
Great report Mr. Twister.  Those are some nice looking pickerel.  Happy to hear things are safe on the bay.  I'll be there in 2 weeks.  Hoping to get into some pike and pickerel.  Corn Nug
nice report!  Thanks for sharing!  Cheers!
I'm heading up there on the 26th for 3 days.  Any tips ?? Also, did you eat that ling ?  We ate a few of them up there last year and man were they ever delicious !!
Good to see a safe hard water report. Congrats on your trip and look forward to your next report. Thanks  Cheers, 1leg
Nice report, thanks for sharing. Looks really cold out there.
Thanks for the report and pics Twister.
WOW nice to see some good results from the big nipissing,   great report guys and nice looking walleyes ...yummy shore lunch.....cheers
Raf and the boys are out there right now, they left yesterday.. good to see that it's safe and the fishn's good. Can't wait to see what they come up with!  Thanks for the report.
I have had a few friend wishing that I would have kept those Lings we caught?I must get over there looks and try them one day..............maybe!
Awesome report.  Thanks.  Cool looking ling.  How about mud puppies, any of those buggers caught?  Joey

Hey Mr. Twister, great report.  I was wondering if you could share some information about the bait situation?  Were you able to get live minnows up there?  I know with the bait ban now in effect I have been warned by the operator we booked with in Temagami that they have no access to live minnows?!!  Thanks in advance. Tony
Great report fellas. Now y'all got everyone rarin' to go.  Minnows are available if you go to the right place. We were able to get shiners in Sturgeon Falls where we fished, at $5.00 / dozen.
As for the minnow situation up there,there was some bait shops around the area that had some.Make arrangements before you head up I would sudgest!Good Luck......Twister
Nice fish. Just currious, do some people call those lings dog fish ? cause I've seen some huge ones before that looked like that ling picture and my grandfather told me they were dog fish.
.....Hey, now there's a couple of familiar faces. Good to see (and read) that you all had a good time.
